post.author: 김승엽
post.content:
- Exchange Tip:Get the service pack
  - Exchange Tip: Get into someone else's mailbox
  - Exchange Tip: Know these basics when installing        
                     Exchange 2000


GET THE SERVICE PACK | by Dave Gabel

If you're using Exchange 2000, this tip will help you unearth Service
Pack 1 from its it is burial ground at the Microsoft Web site. You
can download the patch and find some additional information about it
at the same time.  

>> CLICK for the Full Tip...
http://www.searchWin2000.com/tip/1,289483,sid1_gci774446,00.html


=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
GET INTO SOMEONE ELSE'S MAILBOX | by Adesh Rampat

As a network administrator, there may be situations in which you need
to access another user's mail. Here's how to do it.

>> CLICK for the Full Tip...
http://searchwin2000.techtarget.com/tip/1,289483,sid1_gci761719,00.html


=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
KNOW THESE BASICS WHEN INSTALLING EXCHANGE 2000 | by Osvaldo Brito

SearchWin2000 member Osavaldo Brito offers some simple advice for
setting up an Exchange 2000 installation.

>> CLICK for the Full Tip...
http://searchwin2000.techtarget.com/tip/1,289483,sid1_gci757168,00.html
post.title: Win2000:Exchange Tip
